CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many labels are in this radar chart?
How many dimensions are in this radar chart?

SRP.Q: In the radar chart, what is the next dimension in the clockwise direction from Operating Cost Ratio?
SRP.A: The next dimension clockwise from Operating Cost Ratio is Current Ratio

SRP.Q: In the radar chart, what is the next dimension in the counterclockwise direction from Operating Cost Ratio?
SRP.A: The next dimension counterclockwise from Operating Cost Ratio is ROI.

SRP.Q: On the Market Share Rate, is the point for Davis, Perry and Stephens inside or outside the point for Hampton, Simmons and Savage?
SRP.A: On the Market Share Rate, the point for Davis, Perry and Stephens is inside the point for Hampton, Simmons and Savage.

VPR.Q: Which label encloses the largest score in the radar chart?
VPR.A: label {Net Profit Margin} encloses the largest score

VPR.Q: What are the strongest and weakest dimension of Hampton, Simmons and Savage?
VPR.A: The strongest aspect is {Net Profit Margin}, while the weakest aspect is{ Capacity Utilization Rate}.

VPR.Q: On dimension Market Share Rate, which label scores the highest?
VPR.A: On Market Share Rate, label {Davis, Perry and Stephens} scores the highest.

VPR.Q: On dimension Capacity Utilization Rate, which label scores the highest?
VPR.A: On Capacity Utilization Rate, label {Davis, Perry and Stephens} scores the lowest.

VE.Q: What is the value of Davis, Perry and Stephens on the Current Ratio in the radar chart?
VE.A: The value of Davis, Perry and Stephens on the Safety dimension is {77}.

VE.Q: What is the value of Hampton, Simmons and Savage on the Current Ratio in the radar chart?
VE.A: The value of Hampton, Simmons and Savage on the Safety dimension is {79}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value of label Hampton, Simmons and Savage across all dimensions in the radar chart?
EVJ.A: The maximum value of Hampton, Simmons and Savage across all dimensions is {70}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value of label Hampton, Simmons and Savage across all dimensions in the radar chart?
EVJ.A: The minimum value of Hampton, Simmons and Savage across all dimensions is {66}.

NF.Q: For Hampton, Simmons and Savage in the radar chart, which dimensions have scores below 51? Please list the dimensions and corresponding scores.
NF.A: {Capacity Utilization Rate} is {40}, {Operating Cost Ratio} is {42}

NF.Q: Which labels have scores above 92 for the Net Profit Margin dimension? Please list the labels and corresponding scores.

NC.Q: For Hampton, Simmons and Savage, which dimension has a higher score: Customer Retention Rate or Current Ratio?
NC.A: {Current Ratio} has a higher score than Customer Retention Rate for Hampton, Simmons and Savage.

NC.Q: On Net Profit Margin, which label has a higher score: Davis, Perry and Stephens or the Hampton, Simmons and Savage?
NC.A: {Hampton, Simmons and Savage} has a higher score on Net Profit Margin compared to Davis, Perry and Stephens.

NC.Q: For Hampton, Simmons and Savage, which dimension has a higher score: Customer Retention Rate or Operating Cost Ratio or Capacity Utilization Rate?
NC.A: {Operating Cost Ratio} has a higher score for Hampton, Simmons and Savage.

NC.Q: For Hampton, Simmons and Savage, which dimension has a higher score: Market Share Rate or Net Profit Margin or Capacity Utilization Rate?
NC.A: {Net Profit Margin} has a higher score for Hampton, Simmons and Savage.

MSR.Q: For Davis, Perry and Stephens, based on the data shown in the radar chart, which dimension does it most need to improve?
MSR.A: Davis, Perry and Stephens most needs to improve its {Capacity Utilization Rate}.

MSR.Q: In the radar chart, which label has the strongest overall capability across all labels?
MSR.A: The label with the strongest overall capability is {Hampton, Simmons and Savage}.

MSR.Q: In the radar chart, which label has the weaknest overall capability across all labels?
MSR.A: The label with the weaknest overall capability is {Davis, Perry and Stephens}.
